# What is about ?

Attempt to install entrezdirect on kaggle. 
That package gives access to some info (metadata) on biological datasets in particular from GEO database.
See discussion https://www.biostars.org/p/9483310/ for use case.

-----------------------------------------

Version 9: first successful verision

Versions 1-8: problems with installing/using entrezdirect on kaggle

-----------------------------------------

That package gives access to some info (metadata) on biological datasets in particular from GEO database.
See discussion https://www.biostars.org/p/9483310/ for use case.

However installing package on kaggle is a problem.

One of the problems seems to be - standard way to add directories to PATH does not work on kaggle. 
Something like that: !export PATH=/root/edirect/:$PATH seems does not work
See question: https://www.kaggle.com/general/263170
 

That seems to work:
!sh -c "$(curl -fsSL ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/entrezdirect/install-edirect.sh)"
just you need to press Ctrl+C to return on from the question mode.

After that files seems to be installed in directory: /root/edirect/
and one can launch: !/root/edirect/esearch -db bioproject -query "GSE118723" 


However desired pipeline does not run properly:
!/root/edirect/esearch -db bioproject -query "GSE118723" | /root/edirect/esummary | /root/edirect/xtract -pattern DocumentSummary -element Project_Description
It cannot find one the progs in path.
